page.title: 08FARMS
page.content: The main features of this square are the two farms Demense and Bell House.The land here slopes gradually from west to east and is in direct contrast to the Mirehouse estates, being rural and sparsely populated.The main road link between St.Bees and Whitehaven runs north to south. Both farms are quite old and have family links which stretch considerably,Demense farm being in the same family since the 1700's.Demense has 3/8 of its acreage(413 acres)given over to barley growing and concentrates on beef cattle and sheep production.Bell House while being roughly half the size of Demense with a further 40 acres rented at Bigrigg concentrates more on pig farming.2 acres are used to grow potatoes,but most is cultivated to make hay.
